Web development glossary

31 Aug 2014

Glossary of terms

Markup languages

  • SGML : Standard Generalized Markup Language - the mother of XML and HTML
  • XML : EXtensible Markup Language

  • HTML : HyperText Markup Language

    • HTML element/tag :
          <div>, <html>, <body>, lots more...
    • attribute : A part of an element that provides additional information about that element.

Style sheet languages

  • CSS : Cascading Style Sheet
  • LESS : CSS extension language
  • SASS : Another CSS extension language

Encoding

  • ASCII : American Standard Code for Information Interchange - encoding standard.
  • Unicode : Ubrella term for consistent encoding standards and the Unicode Consortium.
  • UTF-8 : 'U' from Universal Character Set + Transformation Format 8-bit - A specific way to encode all the characters in the Unicode character set.

Javascript

  • JS : JavaScript
  • jQuery : Very popular javascript library, mainly used for DOM manipulation

Miscellaneous

  • the DOM : Document Object Model
  • PHP : Hypertext Preprocessor (original name was: Personal Home Page)
  • W3C : World Wide Web Consortium
Older Newer
